Domesticating wild plant and animal species for human benefit has occurred many
times all over the planet, and has a major impact on the environment, both
positive and negative.

Wildlife can be found in all ecosystems. Deserts, forests, rain forests, plains,
grasslands, other areas including the most developed urban sites, all have
distinct forms of wildlife. While the term in popular culture usually refers to
animals that are untouched by human factors, most scientists agree
that wildlife around is affected by human activities.

Humans have historically tended to separate civilization from wildlife in a
number of ways including the legal, social, and moral sense. Religions have
often declared certain animals to be sacred, and in modern times concern for the
natural environment has provoked activists to protest the exploitation of
wildlife for human benefit or entertainment.
